title: Printing press
description: Basic problem involving print statements only.
instructions:
The simplest thing we usually get our programs to do is to `print` some output.

You will need to print a message, any message!
- Your message needs to be enclosed in quotes, either `'single'` or `"double"`, it doesn't matter as long as they match.
- Your program needs to use the `print` function to print your message.
- The `print` function needs to use round brackets `("around the message")` you are sending.

feedback.title: Used parentheses (round brackets) with your print.
feedback.message: Yes! Your brackets are in the right place.

feedback.title: Add some quoted text inside the print brackets.
feedback.message: Right on! You have matching quotes inside the print!

feedback.title: Put some text in between the quotes.
feedback.message: Alright! You've nailed it! Try running your code to see what it does.

feedback.title: Oh no! An error!
feedback.message: Make sure you read the error message. Try to figure out what it means.

feedback.title: You ran it!
feedback.message: Did your program print out what you expected it to? I hope so!

ungrouped.description: Checking that your program prints something out.
ungrouped.failureMessage:
Make sure you have a message in between your quotes to print out.
It can be anything!
